attributes.action: impose financial sanctions against utility companies who have neglected their customers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the residents of Gloucester, Cheltenham and Tewkesbury facing a period of 7-14 days without running water due to the flooding of the Severn Trent Water treatment works at The Mythe, Tewkesbury, Severn Trent announced that the flooding would not affect their stated profits of £300 million for this year.

Severn Trent's contingency plans of a few hundred bowsers is failing and it is obvious that it can never work.

Central Networks (who are responsible for power distribution) seem to have no contingency plan at all.

This petition urges the Prime Minister to impose financial sanctions against utility companies who have neglected their infrastructure  and instead channelled money to their shareholders. 

It also urges the Prime Minister to pass legislation forcing utility companies to put fully redundant systems in place so that single points of failure such as the Mythe plant or Walham do not exist
